title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 504.1 - Background and intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 504.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) This Part
establishes the process for determining and offering appropriate placement and
services in programs licensed and operated by New York State to individuals
with mental illness receiving transitional care funding. (b) This Part establishes standards for an
administrative review and informal hearing process should an objection to a
placement, which results in a request for an administrative review, be
made. (c) The Office of Mental

Health has a responsibility to assist in locating placements and/or services
for individuals currently receiving transitional care funding and to complete
such placements by January 1, 1999. (d) The Office of Mental Health has
responsibility to assist in locating placements and/or services for an
individual reaching 21 years of age while attending a program or residential
school which provides services to children, in order that no new transitional
care placements occur after July 1, 1996. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14
ยง
504.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
